stem: For each assessment finding, click to specify if the finding indicates a need for intervention, or if the finding is within normal limits for a client at 37 weeks gestation.

rationale.correct: Elevated blood pressure (BP > 140/90) at 37 weeks gestation requires intervention to prevent preeclampsia. Fundal height matching gestational age is normal. Fetal heart rate within normal range (110-160 bpm) is normal. Trace protein in urine is a common finding in pregnancy and is not necessarily indicative of preeclampsia without other symptoms.

mnemonic.description: Blood Pressure Troubles In Pregnancy Signifies Intervention - Remember to consider all vital signs in context of the patient's presentation.

rationale.incorrect: Normal blood pressure is expected at 37 weeks. A fundal height that matches gestational age is considered within normal limits. A fetal heart rate within the range of 110-160 bpm is considered normal. While significant proteinuria is concerning, a trace amount alone is not immediately indicative of a problem, especially without other signs of preeclampsia.

questionTrap.commonMistake: Students may focus on the 'routine visit' aspect and assume all findings are normal. They might underestimate the subtle elevation in blood pressure or dismiss the trace proteinuria without considering the gestational age.
questionTrap.whyMistakeHappens: Lack of critical thinking and failure to connect individual data points to potential complications of pregnancy.

clinicalPearls: Preeclampsia can develop rapidly, especially near term. Regular blood pressure monitoring is crucial.
Fundal height generally correlates with gestational age after 20 weeks, plus or minus 2 cm.
Fetal heart rate is a key indicator of fetal well-being.

itemContext.sbar:
14:00, Situation: Client is a 28-year-old female, G1P0 at 37 weeks gestation, presenting for a routine prenatal visit. 
14:00, Background: She reports feeling well and denies any contractions, leakage of fluid, or vaginal bleeding. Fetal movement is present. She has a history of gestational diabetes, well-controlled with diet, and is Group B Streptococcus (GBS) positive, requiring intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis.
14:00, Assessment: Blood pressure has been slightly elevated at previous visits. Today's assessment includes vital signs, fundal height measurement, fetal heart rate auscultation, and urine dipstick.
14:00, Recommendation: Continue to monitor blood pressure closely. Educate the client on signs and symptoms of preeclampsia. Schedule a follow-up appointment in one week. Discuss the plan for intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis.

tabs.content:

14:00, Background: She reports feeling well and denies any contractions, leakage of fluid, or vaginal bleeding. Fetal movement is present. She has a history of gestational diabetes, well-controlled with diet, and is Group B Streptococcus (GBS) positive, requiring intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis.
14:00, Assessment: Blood pressure has been slightly elevated at previous visits. Today's assessment includes vital signs, fundal height measurement, fetal heart rate auscultation, and urine dipstick.
14:00, Recommendation: Continue to monitor blood pressure closely. Educate the client on signs and symptoms of preeclampsia. Schedule a follow-up appointment in one week. Discuss the plan for intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis.

tabs.title: Vitals
tabs.content:
Blood pressure: 138/88 mmHg
Heart rate: 80 bpm
Respiratory rate: 16 breaths/min
Temperature: 98.6°F (37°C)

tabs.title: Labs
tabs.content:
Urine protein: Trace
Glucose: Within normal limits

tabs.title: PhysicalExam
tabs.content:
Fundal height: 38 cm
Fetal heart rate: 140 bpm, auscultated in the right lower quadrant.

tabs.title: CarePlan
tabs.content:
Monitor blood pressure closely.
Educate the client on signs and symptoms of preeclampsia.
Schedule a follow-up appointment in one week.
Discuss the plan for intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis.

tabs.title: MAR
tabs.content:
Prenatal vitamins: Daily
Insulin (if needed): As prescribed for gestational diabetes management.
Intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis (Penicillin or Clindamycin): To be administered during labor.

patient.medicalHistory: Gestational diabetes, well-controlled with diet. Group B Streptococcus (GBS) positive.
